TestDescription.name: MySQL Enterprise Server v.5.0.52 multiple vulnerabilities
TestDescription.Description: The MySQL Enterprise Server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities. [break] 1. Using RENAME TABLE against a table with explicit DATA DIRECTORY and INDEX DIRECTORY options can be used to overwrite system table information. [break] 2. ALTER VIEW retained the original DEFINER value, even when altered by another user, which could allow that user to gain the access rights of the view. [break] 3. When using a FEDERATED table, the local server can be forced to crash if the remote server returns a result with fewer columns than expected.
TestDescription.Impact: Abuse of functionality: an attacker uses server's features and functionality to consume, defraud, or circumvents access controls mechanisms.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Upgrade the MySQL Enterprise Server tot the latest version.
